factoid: Dron says we all have to die.
Dron says he is not against the commune.
Dron says that he is not against it.
Dron says you have filled your belly.
Two tall peasants spoke.
Rostóv came up to the crowd.
Ilyín came up to the crowd.
Lavrúshka came up to the crowd.
Alpátych came up to the crowd.
Karp walked to the front while thrusting his fingers into his belt and smiling a little.
Dron retired to the rear.
The crowd drew closer together.
Rostóv shouted Who is your Elder here.
Rostóv shouted Hey.
Karp asked The Elder? What do you want with him.
Karp's cap flew off.
A fierce blow jerked Karp's head to one side.
Rostóv shouted Caps off, traitors.
Rostóv cried furiously Where's the Elder.
Someone called The Elder.
Someone said He wants the Elder.
Someone called Dron Zakhárych, you.
Caps began to come off heads.
Karp declared we don't riot, we are following the orders.
Someone said It's as the old men have decided.
Someone said There are too many of you giving orders.
Rostóv cried Arguing? Mutiny! Brigands! Traitors.
Rostóv gripped Karp by the collar.
Rostóv shouted Bind him, bind him.
Lavrúshka seized Karp by the arms from behind.
Lavrúshka asked if he should call up our men from beyond the hill.
Alpátych ordered two peasants to come and bind Karp.
The men took off their belts.
Rostóv demanded Where's the Elder.
Dron stepped out of the crowd with a pale and frowning face.
Rostóv shouted Are you the Elder? Bind him, Lavrúshka.
Two more peasants began binding Dron.
Dron took off his belt and handed it to them.
Rostóv said And you all listen to me.
Rostóv told the peasants to leave their houses at once and not let one of their voices be heard.
Someone said We have not done any harm.
Someone said We did it just out of foolishness.
Someone said It's all nonsense.
Someone said I said then that it was not in order.
Alpátych said There! What did I say.
Alpátych said It's wrong, lads.
Someone answered All our stupidity, Yákov Alpátych.
The crowd dispersed through the village.
The two bound men were led off to the master's house.
The two drunken peasants followed them.
One drunken peasant said Aye, when I look at you to Karp.
The other drunken peasant added How can one talk to the masters like that.
The other drunken peasant added What were you thinking of, you fool.
The other drunken peasant added A real fool.
Two hours later the carts were standing in the courtyard of the Boguchárovo house.
The peasants carried out the proprietor's goods and packed them on the carts.
Dron was liberated at Princess Mary's wish from the cupboard where he had been confined.
Dron was standing in the yard directing the men.
One peasant said Don’t put it in so carelessly.
That peasant had a round smiling face.
The peasant took a casket from a housemaid.
The peasant said You know it has cost money.
The peasant said How can you chuck it in like that or shove it under the cord where it’ll get rubbed.
The peasant said I don’t like that way of doing things.
The peasant said Let it all be done properly according to rule.
The peasant said Look put it under the bast matting and cover it with hay.
The peasant said That is the way.
Another peasant said Eh, books, books.
That peasant brought out Prince Andrew's library cupboards.
The peasant said Don’t catch up against it.
The peasant said It’s heavy, lads—solid books.
